intro: Maesobotrya stapfiana, commonly known as the African sycamore, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves. The tree produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in catkins, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
